title: Douglas Lima will beat Rory MacDonald at Bellator 232, predicts Paul Daley
text:
MacDonald and Lima go to war again this weekend (Picture: Bellator)

Paul Daley believes Douglas Lima will be able to expose Rory MacDonald and gain revenge over his rival in the final of Bellator’s welterweight grand prix.

MacDonald and Lima collide this Saturday at Bellator 232, 21 months after their first classic encounter, which saw the Canadian edge a close battle.

Lima has won twice since that MMA fight, while MacDonald lost to Gegard Mousasi in a move up to middleweight before dropping down to collect a draw and victory as welterweight champion.

Daley has fought both men in his 60-fight career and believes Lima is poised to beat MacDonald.

‘Looking at their past fights and who came out with the most damage, it’s Rory,’ Daley told Metro.co.uk.

Daley doesn’t think MacDonald is the same fighter (Picture: Bellator)

‘He got banged up against Lima, even if he did win that fight. There’s a hell of a lot of money on the line as well as the belt.

‘I’m going to back Lima. I’ve fought them both. Rory is a finisher and has these murderous calm fighting style, but I think Lima will bring it to him and he won’t be able to scrap by this time. He’ll get stopped.’

After a draw with Jon Fitch in April, MacDonald surprised everyone by saying he wasn’t sure if he wanted to ‘hurt’ people anymore. The honest admission led to speculation the former UFC star might retire early.

MacDonald, however, did not hang up his gloves and continued in the grand prix, beating Neiman Gracie to book his place in the final against Lima. The winner of the tournament takes home the welterweight belt, as well as $1million (£776,980) in prize money.

The grand prix winner takes home the belt and $1m (Picture: Getty)

Despite appearing to resolve his doubts, Daley believes it is the prospect of a massive pay day that is keeping MacDonald from retirement.

‘Rory has looked lacklustre,’ Daley explained. ‘I know he’s said he wants to go on in the sport, but I think he just wants to get as much as he can financially from the sport.

‘His performances aren’t the Rory of old. He’s been in big fights and taken a lot of beatings even in victories. His body is feeling it.

‘It’s a matter doing it for the money. Lima has more to prove and wants to be recognised on the big stage, even if people think he’s one of the best in the world anyway.’

Watch Paul Daley in action at Bellator 232 this Saturday night on Sky Sports Action from 2am.
